metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Game Components
Add a red square onto the game area:
content.html: Add a red square onto the game area:

content.text: Add a Component
Make a component constructor, which lets you add components onto the gamearea.
content.html: Make a component constructor, which lets you add components onto the gamearea.

content.text: The object constructor is called component , and we make our first component, called myGamePiece :
content.html: The object constructor is called component, and we make our first component, called myGamePiece:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
var myGamePiece;function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();
    myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);}function component(width, height, color, x, y) {  this.width = width;  this.height = height;  this.x = x;  this.y = y;   ctx = myGameArea.context;  ctx.fillStyle = color;  ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);}

content.code:
var myGamePiece;function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();
myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);}function component(width, height, color, x, y) {  this.width = width;  this.height = height;  this.x = x;  this.y = y;   ctx = myGameArea.context;  ctx.fillStyle = color;  ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);}

syntax_highlighting.text:
var myGamePiece;function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();
    myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);}function component(width, height, color, x, y) {  this.width = width;  this.height = height;  this.x = x;  this.y = y;   ctx = myGameArea.context;  ctx.fillStyle = color;  ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);}

content.code_html:
var myGamePiece;

function startGame() {
  myGameArea.start();
  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);
}

function component(width, height, color, x, y) {
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  ctx = myGameArea.context;
  ctx.fillStyle = color;
  ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
var myGamePiece;function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();
    myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 10, 120);}function component(width, height, color, x, y) {  this.width = width;  this.height = height;  this.x = x;  this.y = y;   ctx = myGameArea.context;  ctx.fillStyle = color;  ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);}

content.text: The components have properties and methods to control their appearances and movements.
content.html: The components have properties and methods to control their appearances and movements.

content.text: Frames
To make the game ready for action, we will update the display 50 times per second, which is much like frames in a movie.
content.html: To make the game ready for action, we will update the display 50 times per second, which is much like frames in a movie.

content.text: First, create a new function called updateGameArea() .
content.html: First, create a new function called updateGameArea().

content.text: In the myGameArea object, add an interval which will run the updateGameArea() function every 20th millisecond (50 times per second). Also add a function called clear() , that clears the entire canvas.
content.html: In the myGameArea object, add an interval which will run the updateGameArea() function every 20th millisecond (50 times per second). Also add a function called clear(), that clears the entire canvas.

content.text: In the component constructor, add a function called update() , to handle the drawing of the component.
content.html: In the component constructor, add a function called update(), to handle the drawing of the component.

content.text: The updateGameArea() function calls the clear() and the update() method.
content.html: The updateGameArea() function calls the clear() and the update() method.

content.text: The result is that the component is drawn and cleared 50 times per second:
content.html: The result is that the component is drawn and cleared 50 times per second:

content.code_html:
var myGameArea = {
  canvas : document.createElement("canvas"),
  start : function() {
    this.canvas.width = 480;
    this.canvas.height = 270;
    this.context = this.canvas.getContext("2d");
    document.body.insertBefore(this.canvas, document.body.childNodes[0]);
    this.interval = setInterval(updateGameArea, 20);
  },
  clear : function() {
    this.context.clearRect(0, 0, this.canvas.width, this.canvas.height);
  }
}

function component(width, height, color, x, y) {
  this.width = width;
  this.height = height;
  this.x = x;
  this.y = y;
  this.update = function(){
    ctx = myGameArea.context;
    ctx.fillStyle = color;
    ctx.fillRect(this.x, this.y, this.width, this.height);
  }
}

function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Make it Move
To prove that the red square is being drawn 50 times per second, we will change the x position (horizontal) by one pixel every time we update the game area:
content.html: To prove that the red square is being drawn 50 times per second, we will change the x position (horizontal) by one pixel every time we update the game area:

content.code_html:
function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  myGamePiece.x += 1;
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Why Clear The Game Area?

It might seem unnecessary to clear the game area at every update. However, if we leave out the clear() method, all movements of the component will leave a trail of where it was positioned in the last frame:
content.html: It might seem unnecessary to clear the game area at every update. However, if we leave out the clear() method, all movements of the component will leave a trail of where it was positioned in the last frame:

content.code_html:
function updateGameArea() {
  // myGameArea.clear();
  myGamePiece.x += 1;
  myGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Change the Size
You can control the width and height of the component:
content.html: You can control the width and height of the component:

syntaxHighlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(140, 10, "red", 10, 120);}

content.code: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(140, 10, "red", 10, 120);}

}

content.text: Change the Color
You can control the color of the component:
content.html: You can control the color of the component:

syntaxHighlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "blue", 10, 120);}

content.code: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "blue", 10, 120);}

}

content.text: You can also use other colorvalues like hex, rgb, or rgba:
content.html: You can also use other colorvalues like hex, rgb, or rgba:

syntaxHighlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.5)", 10, 120);}

  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.5)", 10, 120);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.5)", 10, 120);}

content.text: Change the Position
We use x- and y-coordinates to position components onto the game area.
content.html: We use x- and y-coordinates to position components onto the game area.

content.text: The upper-left corner of the canvas has the coordinates (0,0)
content.html: The upper-left corner of the canvas has the coordinates (0,0)

content.text: Mouse over the game area below to see its x and y coordinates:
content.html: Mouse over the game area below to see its x and y coordinates:

content.text: You can position the components wherever you like on the game area:
content.html: You can position the components wherever you like on the game area:

syntaxHighlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 2, 2);}

content.code: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 2, 2);}

syntax_highlighting.text: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 2, 2);}

content.code_html:
function startGame() {
  myGameArea.start();
  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 2, 2);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: function startGame() {  myGameArea.start();  myGamePiece = new component(30, 30, "red", 2, 2);}

content.text: Many Components
You can put as many components as you like on the game area:
content.html: You can put as many components as you like on the game area:

content.code_html:
var redGamePiece, blueGamePiece, yellowGamePiece;

 function startGame() {
  redGamePiece = new component(75, 75, "red", 10, 10);
  yellowGamePiece = new component(75, 75, "yellow", 50, 60);
  blueGamePiece = new component(75, 75, "blue", 10, 110);
  myGameArea.start();
}

function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  redGamePiece.update();
  yellowGamePiece.update();
  blueGamePiece.update();
}

content.text: Moving Components
Make all three components move in different directions:
content.html: Make all three components move in different directions:

content.code_html:
function updateGameArea() {
  myGameArea.clear();
  redGamePiece.x += 1;
  yellowGamePiece.x += 1;
  yellowGamePiece.y += 1;
  blueGamePiece.x += 1;
  blueGamePiece.y -= 1;
  redGamePiece.update();
  yellowGamePiece.update();
  blueGamePiece.update();
}
